posts.title: AWS re:Invent
posts.author: Tristan Setha
posts.preview_content: At EAS I had the opportunity to work alongside a team of designers, project managers, and other engineers to develop an online personality test platform for the AWS Reinvent event.

post_content.element_content: AWS re:Invent is a learning conference hosted by Amazon Web Services (AWS) for the global cloud computing community. It's AWS's biggest cloud event of the year.
At EAS I had the opportunity to work alongside a team of designers, project managers, and other engineers to develop an online personality test platform for the AWS Reinvent event.

Develop a new website and an experience for the AWS re:Invent Superhero Personality Test — a seven-question interactive quiz designed to determine which superhero a user aligns with the most. The project will be showcased at the re:Invent 2023 event in collaboration with AWS Analytics.
The quiz will determine which Hero (Cloud Sight, Wire Weaver, Data Lynx) the user most identifies with based on 7 questions. Each question assigns points to one or more hero alignments.
At the end, the user gets matched with the hero with the highest score.
Each hero is associated with one or more themes, providing users with recommended sessions to attend during the event.
The website was developed using EAS’s internal tooling, which incorporates Gulp.js, PHP, Node.js, Sass, the GreenSock Animation Library, and HTML5 Web Components.

posts.title: TDECU Map Locator
posts.author: Tristan Setha
posts.preview_content: A web application designed to help TDECU members find dealerships associated with TDECU

post_content.element_content: At EAS, I had the opportunity to work on a dealership locator designed to help TDECU members find dealerships associated with TDECU.

Develop a portable and reusable web application that leverages the Google Maps API to utilize the user's current location. This application will enable users to locate and sort through nearby dealerships based on their name and distance.
The application was built using a stack that includes Google Maps API, Gulp.js, PHP, Node.js, Sass, and HTML5 Web Components.
